about.name: Andy Deng
about.title: CS Student @ Boston College
about.description: Hello! I am Andy Deng, and I am a current junior studying Computer Science and Finance at Boston College. I have a passion for building meaningful  software in a supportive and collaborative environment! I have experience in many stages of software development including both front-end and back-end. I am proficient in languages such as JavaScript, Java, Python and have quality experience working with OCaml and C++. I hope to never stop learning and use my skills and experience to contribute to something that has true purpose and meaning!
about.interests_desc: Interests: Web Development, Machine Learning, Software Engineering, Graphics/Visual computing

events.title: Working for Boston College IT Services

projects.title: Personal Portfolio Website
projects.description: This is my personal portfolio website that I created using pure JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. The website itself is separated into different components for readability purposes as well as to mimic frameworks such as React and Angular. It adapts to different screen sizes and uses icons from Font Awesome.

projects.title: Instagram Copy
projects.description: This project is a partial clone of instagram that I created using React. It includes a home page, a profile page, and a way to upload new posts. It utilizes React Router to support various navigations in the app and saves user data into a remote database using Firestore.

projects.title: Recursion Teaching Tool
projects.description: After interviewing numerous CS students, we noticed that an overwhelming majority of them listed recursion as the most challenging topic to understand. Our website is designed around the goal of having visual tools, practice problems, and other resources available all in one place to aid course material. It designed around user testing and feedback to optimize user experience.
